body.name: Koonie 10000mAh Rechargeable Portable Fan, 8-Inch Battery Operated Clip on Fan, USB Fan, 4 Speeds, Strong Airflow, Sturdy Clamp for Office Desk Golf Car Outdoor Travel Camping Tent Gym Treadmill
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 6 hrs 52 mins
FREE delivery Monday, February 26 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: 【Powerful Battery Capacity】This rechargeable fan comes along with a 10000mAh battery that even can last up to 24 hours when fully charged. It is convenient to use the battery operated fan so you’ll never have to fuss with wires or cords.

【2 in 1 Fan】The portable fan combine clip fan with desk fan. With a strong 3 inch clamp that allows them to attach to unusual places, such as the edge of a desk, the frame of a treadmill or even a nightstand for those who tend to get overheated.

【Super Technology】This rechargeable fan is super quiet and super strong airflow. The battery powered rechargeable fan is equipped with three 8-inch blades, which can swirl faster. With special technology, which is pretty quiet when working even at high speed whenever your baby is sleep or you are working.

【Fast Charging】This battery fan supports 5V-2A fast charging, which can be fully charged within 6 hours. Coming with type-c charging port, the USB fan's charging port compatible with multiple devices including laptops, cell phone adapters, mobile power and USB charger.

【Flexible Adjustment】The clip fan has a nimble head that can rotate 360 degrees vertically and horizontally. The portable rechargeable fan has 3 speed settings + 1 energy saving setting so you can direct the air however you’d like.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A real fan that can go anywhere. Almost perfect.
reviews.reviewText: Quick summary: this fan provides sufficient airflow for personal cooling (much more than most small USB or battery powered fans provide), in a compact package with good battery life and multiple charging options. The only flaw so far is that it is too easy to activate it accidentally.Full review:To set the context, heat is my enemy. I hate warm weather. I keep my house at 68F and I always have a fan running at my desk or beside my bed. So when planning a two week trip to Italy in the summertime I knew I would want to bring a fan with me.In the past I have used the small 4” diameter USB powered fans that are commonly sold on Amazon but the airflow is weak and they wear out and begin to rattle quickly. They also require a USB power source at all times. I also use a Ryobi portable jobsite site fan sometimes but it is too large and heavy to pack.The ideal portable fan should produce ample airflow, pack relatively flat, store enough power for a decent runtime, and be easy to charge. Durability and quiet operation are important factors as well.This fan (The oddly named Koonie) delivers on all counts. Airflow is excellent. Most of the time I have it on the medium setting. It is quiet, and more compact than I expected. The clip folds sideways making the whole fan about 3-4” thick when packed flat. It’s not exactly small but I had no trouble fitting it in a day pack when traveling. I haven’t tested the total battery life yet but after a couple of hours on a train it was still showing full charge (more on that later). It charges with both micro USB and USC-c, which is great. More importantly it will run while charging, so you can power it with a USB-c charger all night and then take it with you on a day trip first thing in the morning. The clip is quite effective and I’ve had no trouble attaching it to a variety of mounting points. I’ve included a photo of the fan clipped to the overhead luggage rack in an Italian train. Overall, this fan has checked all my requirements, and I sincerely wish I’d had this years ago.Nit Picking:- The button that activates the fan is flush with the back surface, and while it’s a perfectly nice, clicky button, it is easy to activate the fan when it’s packed in luggage or a backpack. I found it running on more than one occasion. I plan to put a layer of packing tape over the button to reduce accidental activations.- The battery life indicator is nice to have, but could stand to be more granular. It has four levels: 100%, 60%, 30% and nothing (all lights dead). Many fans have no charge indicator at all, so this is hardly a complaint worth mentioning.Other than that I can’t find anything to complain about. The build quality is higher than I expected and I don’t think it will break unless abused. I should note that I don’t know what sort of bearings it has, so longevity is uncertain. I also haven’t fully tested the max runtime. Other than that I can confidently recommend this to anyone who needs a portable, compact, battery powered fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best portable fan!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I don't usually write reviews but the truth needs to be out about this fan, if i could give it 10 stars i would this is absolutely the strongest best little fan i have owned in my life i was shocked with the performance, never in my life have i ever used a little fan this strong even the vintage tiny metal blade cut your finger off fans are not this strong and definitely quieter than the old fans too, its so strong for a little fan i actually placed it at a great distance from my bed sitting on my heater and it still feels strong from a distance dont even think about it if you car camp van camp or just need a portable fan this is it! Battery lasts a long time as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong, long lasting, reliable battery fan
reviews.reviewText: We have several battery powered fans and this is one of my favorites. The amount of wind it moves with minimal noise is impressive, and though we normally keep it plugged in, we've been able to use it on medium for 5-6 hours during power outages. The base is a clip mechanism but it's pretty stable on a tabletop. It can charge off of micro-USB or USB-C. It has separate LED indicators for fan speed and charge level, and the lights (which are tiny) are amber so if you are like me and dislike blue light in the room when you're trying to sleep, it might be less annoying. We haven't had occasion to use the clamp mount but it's a nice option to have. This fan is light and easy to move, and the grill comes off for easier cleaning.I liked this fan so much I bought one to give as a housewarming gift, and the recipient liked it so much she bought a second one to keep around the house. I have come to love cordless fans even more than I love cordless vacuum cleaners! Immensely useful for more than just power outages. And this Koonie 8-inch fan is a great choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We are in our renovated Airstream full time while we build our house & it’s a bit hard to have a fan with the small space, but this little thing packs a punch! I’ve had mine for over a year now and they work great. I have one in my main seating area and one in my bedroom. The motor noise is still consistent with out if the box quality, nice a quiet humm. We live in the desert where it is very dusty and I love that I can remove the face for easy cleaning (simply twist to the left and pull face off). Mine stay plugged in, but will hold a charge all night, if needed. Airflow is amazing; I never have a need to have it above medium speed. My husband even tries to steal the direction of our bedroom fan and he enjoys it from his side of the end, as well. I offered to buy him one for his side, but we both agreed the price is a bit steep. However, price aside, We are happy with our fans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good strength, but clamp really tight
reviews.reviewText: Good size rechargeable fan for when I sit outside in summer, but clamp is super tight, and doesn't seem designed good for being able to attach to multiple things. A hanger hook might have been better, like the other smaller fan I have. However, the clamp can be moved to almost be a base on a table.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous for professional musician with outdoor concerts!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a professional musician who hates the heat! I used to carry a plug in fan for our outdoor concerts, but that was cumbersome, and it would be problematic for the venues where there were no plugs. This is perfect because it clips tightly onto the music stand (the hefty ones, not wire stands), isn't too loud to affect the mikes and is much easier/smaller to carry but big enough to get plenty of circulation. I love that it's rechargeable and I don't have to worry about batteries, which would make it heavy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very adjustable. Strong and durable clamp base. The fan speed at the highest level is good. Pretty quiet.I have two of these in my room. Very much recommend

Summary: Not only does it save space, but it is conveniently wireless when needed, and is powerful enough to stand up against full-sized fans....I love this little fan. I took it on a trip recently, because I need white noise to fall asleep, and I am always hot LOLThe price is worth the quality, and special features, in my opinion.I was honestly just looking for a wired fan, but the fact that it is wireless is really cool. You charge it using a charging cable, and the battery life is actually quite good (on the highest setting, I could get away with 7-hours unplugged, almost a full night's sleep). This means less cables cluttering your space, and you can take it somewhere where there may not be any power outlets.The strength of the fan is what really surprised me. For it's size, I wasn't expecting much. But it's actually more powerful than some older, full-size fans I own. It reaches across a normal sized room on full-power.The clip is incredibly strong. I don't worry about hitting it in the night and having it fall on the floor. The clip also doubles as a regular stand. You can put it on your desk, side-table, or even a ledge if you don't have the space!It is also very compact. It turns completely around on the base so it can lay it flat if you need to carry it in a bag, and can be moved around when in use so you always get the best angle.Very happy with this purchase, I would advise others to buy one :)

reviews.reviewerName: Excelente producto! En tiempo y atención
reviews.reviewText: Llego en tiempo y me encanto el producto vale mucho la pena
La batería si duró toda la noche a velicidad baja, que fué suficiente para dormir agusjto

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente flujo de aire, larga duración de batería.
reviews.reviewText: Lo primero que me gustaría mencionar es su construcción, es resistente y se mueve perfectamente en todas direcciones sin que se dificulte el dejarlo fijo en la posición deseada. El clip de sujeción es increíblemente resistente, necesitas de las 2 manos para abrirlo y se fija muy bien a diferentes superficies y formas, tiene una protección plástica tipo espuma para no dañar la superficie del lugar al que lo sujetas. Su peso no es demasiado, y es relativamente compacto. Su batería es muy duradera, es difícil precisar la duración máxima porqué lo he usado por horas y no he podido terminar la carga. El flujo de aire es muy bueno, incluso en la velocidad más baja y el ruido en la más alta es bastante tolerable. Considero que su desempeño es bastante bueno y su precio no es tan alto.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I reviewed this Koonie product online before my purchase and was impressed with good reports. I use mine on low (audible but not noisy), this speed is adequate to cool me off and has a calming effect, I use it on battery most of the time (which seems to last many hours) but cannot say exactly how long before a recharge is needed, when using my computer I connect it via usb to top up the battery while in use. The two charging ports is a good idea. I have accidently knocked it off a height of 1m on three occasions (fortunately remains undamaged).
